cnbc.title: Trump administration must pay SNAP benefits despite government shutdown, judge rules
cnbc.summary: The Justice Department argued that the food stamp program, which feeds more than 40 million Americans, effectively did not exist anymore due to the shutdown.

cnbc.title: Millions face 'huge sticker shock' when ACA open enrollment starts Nov. 1
cnbc.summary: Millions of households logging on to enroll in a health plan via the Affordable Care Act marketplace will see much higher premiums.

cnbc.title: Tariffs are expected to start showing up more in consumer prices as holiday shopping season starts
cnbc.summary: Impacts have been muted so far as companies built up inventories ahead of the duties and have absorbed some of the impact.

cnbc.title: Amazon's stock soars 10% on third-quarter beat, increased spending guidance
cnbc.summary: Amazon blew past analyst estimates in its third-quarter earnings report and raised its capital expenditures forecast for the year to $125 billion.

cnbc.title: Tech's $380 billion splurge: This quarter's winners and losers of the AI spending boom
cnbc.summary: With the largest cloud and internet companies reporting results this week, it's clear that spending on artificial intelligence is only increasing.

cnbc.title: Reddit stock jumps 7% after showing strong advertising and user growth
cnbc.summary: Reddit's stock popped after the company surpassed third-quarter estimates due to strong advertising growth.

cnbc.title: Disney channels go dark on YouTube TV as carriage deal expires
cnbc.summary: Disney content, including channels like ABC and ESPN, was removed from YouTube TV overnight, after the two companies failed to renew a contract.

cnbc.title: Trump touts marble Lincoln Bathroom remodel amid government shutdown
cnbc.summary: Trump's bathroom update follows his major makeover of the Oval Office, and the demolition of the White House East Wing, to be replaced by a large ballroom.
